means: [人名] 普雷舍斯，普雷舍丝（女名）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均含"贵重的，有价值的"之意。
means: valuable ： 指有相当价值，可高价出售的，或有用、有益的东西。
precious ： 指因稀罕、不易得到而很值钱，或因本身的品质而具有极大的价值。

word_mean: 珍稀濒危水生野生动物
rare and endangered aquatic animal 在自然水域中生息繁衍，有重要科学价值、经济价值或生态价值，种群数量稀少，且濒临灭绝的水生野生动物。

sentence.Network_cn: 极少数购房者会注意到他们月还款额的减少。

sentence.Network_en: The banks have had precious little to celebrate recently.
sentence.Network_cn: 银行最近没几件值得庆贺的事。

sentence.Network_en: After four months in foreign parts, every hour at home was precious.
sentence.Network_cn: 在国外呆了4个月后，在家的每一刻都是宝贵的。

jx.jx_en_mean: extremely little or few (used for emphasis)

lj.lj_ly: police still know precious little about the dead man.
lj.lj_ls: 警察对那死去的男子仍然所知无几。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French precios, from Latin pretiosus 'of great value', from pretium 'price'

encyclopedia.content: precious，英语单词，主要义项是珍贵宝贵。有同名的歌曲由日本歌手伊藤由奈演唱，以及同名的美国电影。

entry.def: If you say that something such as a resource is precious, you mean that it is valuable and should not be wasted or used badly.

example.ex: After four months in foreign parts, every hour at home was precious...
example.tran: 在国外呆了4个月后，在家的每一刻都是宝贵的。

example.ex: A family break allows you to spend precious time together...
example.tran: 家庭度假会让你们一起度过宝贵的时光。

entry.def: Precious objects and materials are worth a lot of money because they are rare.

example.ex: ...jewellery and precious objects belonging to her mother.
example.tran: 她妈妈的珠宝和珍奇物品

entry.tran: 值得珍视的；可贵的；重要的
entry.def: If something is precious to you, you regard it as important and do not want to lose it.

example.ex: Her family's support is particularly precious to Josie...
example.tran: 家庭的支持对乔茜来说尤为可贵。

example.ex: Mary left her most precious possession — a small bookcase — to her niece.
example.tran: 玛丽把她最珍视的财产——一个小书架，留给了她的侄女。

entry.tran: 宝贝似的（强调对别人珍视的东西表示厌恶）
entry.def: People sometimes use precious to emphasize their dislike for things which other people think are important.

example.ex: You don't care about anything but yourself and your precious face.
example.tran: 你什么都不关心，除了你自己和你那张娇贵的脸。

entry.tran: 矫揉造作的；一本正经的
entry.def: If you describe someone as precious, you mean that they behave in a formal and unnatural way.

example.ex: Actors, he decided, were too precious and neurotic.
example.tran: 他认定演员们太做作，并且都神经兮兮的。

entry.def: If you say that there is precious little of something, you are emphasizing that there is very little of it, and that it would be better if there were more. Precious few has a similar meaning.

example.ex: The banks have had precious little to celebrate recently...
example.tran: 银行最近没几件值得庆贺的事。

example.ex: Precious few homebuyers will notice any reduction in their monthly repayments.
example.tran: 极少数购房者会注意到他们月还款额的减少。

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by feeling or showing fond affection for;

sentences.sentence: "diamonds, sapphires, rubies, and emeralds are precious stones"

auth_sentence.content: Most of these precious babies are also undeniably cute.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of these precious babies are also undeniably cute.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most of these precious babies are also undeniably cute.

auth_sentence.content: This article only demonstrates how precious it really is.
auth_sentence.res_content: This article only demonstrates how precious it really is.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This article only demonstrates how precious it really is.

auth_sentence.content: Well, there was precious little danger of that!
auth_sentence.res_content: Well, there was precious little danger of that!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well, there was precious little danger of that!

stems_affixes.word_buile: ap加强+preci价值,估价+able能……的→adj.可估价的;可察觉的
depreciate[v.贬低,贬值]+ion表名词→n.折旧,价值下降
ap一再+preci价值+ate表动词→一再给价→欣赏
de去掉+preci价值,估价+ate表动词→去掉价值→贬值

Sentence.sentence: Wasting food means losing not only life-supporting nutrition but also precious resources, including land, water and energy.

means.word_mean: 宝贵的, 珍贵的, 贵重的, 珍爱的

sentences.en: He has sent me most precious gifts.
sentences.cn: 他送给我极其珍贵的礼物。

sentences.en: She was a precious, old-fashioned lady in her 90's.
sentences.cn: 她是一个90多岁的、过分讲究的旧式老太太。

sentences.en: Precious few people can afford prices like that.
sentences.cn: 没有什么人出得起那个价钱。

jushi.english: He poured a few drops of the precious liquid into the glass.
jushi.chinese: 他往杯子里倒了几滴这种珍贵的液体。

jushi.english: That old toy is my most precious possession.
jushi.chinese: 那个旧玩具是我最珍爱的家产。
